column4: I have two hard drives, hda and hdb. hda is not partitioned, hdb is partitioned into two fat32 partitions, an ext3, and a swap partition. Windows is installed on hda, and Ubuntu is installed on hdb. After I installed Ubuntu on a partition on hdb, Windows sees hdb as one giant raw disk, and Ubuntu sees the partitions fine.
Why is this happening - what can I do to fix it?
Anyone?
zorba: hdb is partitioned into two fat32 partitions, an ext3, and a swap partition.
zorba: Windows sees ALL OF IT, as one raw disk.
not sure what you mean since you said you installed windows on an unpartitioned device
I mean, hda contains a single partition.
my guess is your partitioner did not actually create the FAT partitions, OR, windows isn't displaying them unless you tell it to, which I've seen it do iirc
which steps exactly did you take to creating the FAT partitions?
what else do you need to know?

making FAT is usually a two-step process for me.  I have to partition the drive for FAT, set the type of partition to FAT, and also run another tool to initialize as FAT

I normally use fdisk and then mkfs.vfat iirc
